chat.content:
I will give you a Coq proof state, including both hypotheses and a specific goal and your need to prove it. Your response should be a singular code block of Coq proof starting with "```coq
", ending with "Qed.```", without any additional explanation or commentary. Follow to these guidelines:
Introduce variables using unique names to avoid any conflicts.
Keep each command distinct and separated, avoid concatenations like ';' or '[cmd|cmd]'.
Organize your proof with bullets like '-', '+', and '*' instead of braces ({, }). Shift to their double symbols like '--' and '++', when necessary.
Effectively use given premises, follow the syntax and structure demonstrated in the examples provided.

Example 1:

Hypotheses:
n, m: nat
IHn: m + n = n + m

Goal:
m + S n = S n + m

Proof:
```coq
simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Example 2:
Hypotheses:

Goal:
forall n m : nat, m + n = n + m

```coq
intros n m. induction n.
- simpl. auto.
- simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Solve This Proof State:

Hypotheses:
V: Type
labF: V -> [ordType of nat]

Goal:
is_true (valid unit)

Premises:
is_true = eq^~ true : bool -> Prop Arguments is_true _%bool_scope is_true is a coercion
Inductive nat : Set := O : nat | S : nat -> nat Arguments S _%nat_scope
Notation unit := (DepMaps.unit labF)
Notation ordType := Ordered.type
valid : forall (V : Type) (labF : V -> Label), depmap labF -> bool
last_key : forall V : Type, union_map [ordType of nat] V -> nat
fresh : forall V : Type, union_map [ordType of nat] V -> nat
onPhantom : forall (P : ?T -> Prop) (x : ?T), phantom Prop (P x) where ?T : [V : Type labF : V -> [ordType of nat] |- Type]
last_key_max : forall (V : Type) (f : union_map [ordType of nat] V) (x : [ordType of nat]), x \in dom f -> x <= last_key f
dom_ordfresh : forall (V : Type) (f : union_map [ordType of nat] V) (x : [ordType of nat]), x \in dom f -> x < fresh f
max_key_last : forall (V : Type) (f : union_map [ordType of nat] V) (x : [ordType of nat]), x \in dom f -> {in dom f, forall y : nat, y <= x} -> last_key f = x
Label = [ordType of nat] : ordType
Record depmap (V : Type) (labF : V -> Label) : Type := DepMap { dmap : union_map Label V; pf : is_true (dmDom labF dmap) } Arguments depmap [V]%type_scope _%function_scope Arguments DepMap [V]%type_scope [labF]%function_scope [dmap]
valid_fresh' : forall (V : Type) (f : union_map [ordType of nat] V) (v : V) (i : [ordType of nat]) (w : V), PCM.Exports.valid (f \+ i \\-> w) -> PCM.Exports.valid (f \+ fresh (f \+ i \\-> w) \\-> v)
last_key_dom : forall (V : Type) (f : union_map [ordType of nat] V), PCM.Exports.valid f -> last_key f \notin dom f -> f = Unit
dom_last_key : forall (V : Type) (f : union_map [ordType of nat] V), PCM.Exports.valid f -> ~~ empb f -> last_key f \in dom f
last_keyfUn : forall (V : Type) (f1 f2 : union_map [ordType of nat] V), PCM.Exports.valid (f1 \+ f2) -> last_key f1 <= last_key (f1 \+ f2)
last_keyUnf : forall (V : Type) (f1 f2 : union_map [ordType of nat] V), PCM.Exports.valid (f1 \+ f2) -> last_key f2 <= last_key (f1 \+ f2)
last_key_mono : forall (V : Type) (f1 f2 : union_map [ordType of nat] V), {subset dom f1 <= dom f2} -> last_key f1 <= last_key f2
last_fresh : forall (V : Type) (f : union_map [ordType of nat] V) (v : V), PCM.Exports.valid f -> last_key (f \+ fresh f \\-> v) = fresh f
dom_fresh : forall (V : Type) (f : union_map [ordType of nat] V), fresh f \notin dom f
hist_path : forall (V : Type) (f : union_map [ordType of nat] V), path oleq 0 (dom f)
UMC.sort : forall (K : ordType) (V : Type), union_map_class K V -> Type
dom_freshn : forall (V : Type) (f : union_map [ordType of nat] V) (n : nat), fresh f + n \notin dom f
valid_fresh : forall (V : Type) (f : union_map [ordType of nat] V) (v : V), PCM.Exports.valid (f \+ fresh f \\-> v) = PCM.Exports.valid f
Record seq_sub (T : eqType) (s : seq T) : Type := SeqSub { ssval : Equality.sort T; ssvalP : is_true (ssval \in s) } Arguments fintype.seq_sub [T] _%seq_scope Arguments fintype.SeqSub [T] [s]%seq_scope [ssval]
dmDom : forall V : Type, (V -> Label) -> union_map Label V -> bool
rel = fun T : Type => T -> pred T : Type -> Type Arguments rel _%type_scope
*** [ UMDef.tp : ordType -> Type -> Type ] Arguments UMDef.tp _ _%type_scope
um_pts : forall (K : ordType) (V : Type), K -> V -> union_mapUMC K V
Record finMap (K : ordType) (V : Type) : Type := FinMap { seq_of : seq (K * V); _ : is_true (sorted ord [seq key i | i <- seq_of]) } Arguments finMap _ _%type_scope Arguments FinMap [K] [V]%type_scope [seq_of]%seq_scope
dmap : forall (V : Type) (labF : V -> Label), depmap labF -> union_map Label V
UM.pts : forall (K : ordType) (V : Type) (p : pred K), K -> V -> UM.base V p
Inductive base (K : ordType) (V : Type) (p : pred K) : Type := Undef : UM.base V p | Def : forall f : {finMap K -> V}, all p (supp f) -> UM.base V p Arguments UM.base [K] _%type_scope Arguments UM.Undef [K] _%type_scope Arguments UM.Def [K] [V]%type_scope [p f]
join : forall (V : Type) (labF : V -> Label), depmap labF -> depmap labF -> depmap labF

```coq
unfold is_true, valid, unit.
simpl.
rewrite dmDom_unit.
auto.
